verses.verse: Naomi <S%H5281><s%> her mother-in <S%H2545><s%>-law said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H1323><s%> "My daughter, shall I not seek <S%H1245><s%> rest <S%H4494><s%> for you, <S%H3190><s%> that it may be well with you?

Now isn't <S%H1162><s%> Boaz our kinsman, <S%H4130><s%> with whose maidens <S%H5291><s%> you were? <S%H2219><s%> Behold, he winnows barley <S%H8184><s%> tonight <S%H3915><s%> in the threshing floor. <S%H1637><s%>

Therefore wash <S%H7364><s%> yourself, <S%H5480><s%> anoint yourself, <S%H7760><s%> get dressed, <S%H8071><s%> and go down <S%H3381><s%> to the threshing floor, <S%H1637><s%> but don't <S%H3045><s%> make yourself known to the man <S%H376><s%> until he has finished <S%H3615><s%> eating <S%H398><s%> and drinking. <S%H8354><s%>

It shall be, <S%H7901><s%> when he lies down, that you shall mark <S%H3045><s%> the place <S%H4725><s%> where he shall lie, <S%H7901><s%> and you shall go in, <S%H935><s%> and uncover <S%H1540><s%> his feet, <S%H4772><s%> and lay down; <S%H7901><s%> then he will tell <S%H5046><s%> you what you shall do. <S%H6213><s%>"
She said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H559><s%> "All that you say I will do. <S%H6213><s%>"
She went down <S%H3381><s%> to the threshing floor, <S%H1637><s%> and did <S%H6213><s%> according to all that her mother-in <S%H2545><s%>-law told her. <S%H6680><s%>

When Boaz <S%H1162><s%> had eaten <S%H398><s%> and drunk, <S%H8354><s%> and his heart <S%H3820><s%> was merry, <S%H3190><s%> he went <S%H935><s%> to lie down <S%H7901><s%> at the end <S%H7097><s%> of the heap of grain. <S%H6194><s%> She came <S%H935><s%> softly, <S%H3909><s%> uncovered <S%H1540><s%> his feet, <S%H4772><s%> and laid her down. <S%H7901><s%>

It happened at midnight, <S%H2677><s%> that the man <S%H376><s%> was startled <S%H2729><s%> and turned <S%H3943><s%> himself; <S%H802><s%> and behold, a woman lay <S%H7901><s%> at his feet. <S%H4772><s%>

He said, <S%H559><s%> "Who are you? <S%H559><s%>" She answered, "I <S%H7327><s%> am your handmaid. <S%H519><s%> Therefore spread <S%H6566><s%> your skirt <S%H3671><s%> over your handmaid; <S%H519><s%> for you are a near kinsman. <S%H1350><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "Blessed <S%H1288><s%> are you by Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> my daughter. <S%H1323><s%> You have shown <S%H3190><s%> more kindness <S%H2617><s%> in the latter end <S%H314><s%> than at the beginning, <S%H7223><s%> inasmuch as you didn't <S%H1115><s%> follow <S%H3212><s%> young men, <S%H970><s%> whether poor <S%H1800><s%> or rich. <S%H6223><s%>

Now, <S%H1323><s%> my daughter, don't <S%H3372><s%> be afraid; I will do <S%H6213><s%> to you all that you say; <S%H559><s%> for all the city <S%H8179><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> does know <S%H3045><s%> that you are a worthy <S%H2428><s%> woman. <S%H802><s%>
Now it is true <S%H551><s%> that I am a near kinsman; <S%H1350><s%> however there is <S%H3426><s%> a kinsman <S%H1350><s%> nearer than I. <S%H7138><s%>

Stay <S%H3885><s%> this night, <S%H3915><s%> and it shall be in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> that if he will perform for you the part of a kinsman, <S%H1350><s%> well; <S%H2896><s%> let him do the kinsman <S%H1350><s%>'s part. But if he will <S%H2654><s%> not do the part of a kinsman <S%H1350><s%> for you, <S%H1350><s%> then will I do the part of a kinsman for you, <S%H3068><s%> as Yahweh lives. <S%H2416><s%> Lie down <S%H7901><s%> until the morning. <S%H1242><s%>"

She lay <S%H7901><s%> at his feet <S%H4772><s%> until the morning. <S%H1242><s%> She rose up <S%H6965><s%> before <S%H2958><s%> one <S%H376><s%> could discern <S%H5234><s%> another. <S%H7453><s%> For he said, <S%H559><s%> "Let it not be known <S%H3045><s%> that the woman <S%H802><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to the threshing floor. <S%H1637><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "Bring <S%H3051><s%> the mantle <S%H4304><s%> that is on you, <S%H270><s%> and hold it. <S%H270><s%>" She held it; <S%H4058><s%> and he measured six <S%H8337><s%> measures of barley, <S%H8184><s%> and laid <S%H7896><s%> it on her; <S%H935><s%> and he went into the city. <S%H5892><s%>

When she came <S%H935><s%> to her mother-in <S%H2545><s%>-law, she said, <S%H559><s%> "How did it go, <S%H1323><s%> my daughter?" She told <S%H559><s%> her all that the man <S%H376><s%> had done to her. <S%H6213><s%>

She said, <S%H559><s%> "He gave <S%H5414><s%> me these six <S%H8337><s%> measures of barley; <S%H8184><s%> for he said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H935><s%> 'Don't go empty <S%H7387><s%> to your mother-in <S%H2545><s%>-law.'"

Then she said, <S%H559><s%> "Sit still, <S%H3427><s%> my daughter, <S%H1323><s%> until you know <S%H3045><s%> how the matter <S%H1697><s%> will fall; <S%H5307><s%> for the man <S%H376><s%> will not rest, <S%H8252><s%> until <S%H518><s%> he has finished <S%H3615><s%> the thing <S%H1697><s%> this day. <S%H3117><s%>"
